page.title: 10Tourism-Beamish
page.content: The major tourist attraction in this area is the 'North of England Open Air Museum' at Beamish.The museum is administered by four County Councils:Cleveland,Northumberland,Tyne and Wear and Durham.The museum site,once part of the Beamish Hall Estate,covers about two hundred acres of woodland and countryside.Old buildings from all parts of the region are being dismantled and then rebuilt and equipped at Beamish with period furniture and machinery.These buildings are grouped together to create communities as they used to be in the early 1900's.The museum is divided into areas joined by footpaths and tramways.
